subject: Re: More on parralel systems
msgSnippet: I remember I made a braille copy based on Shavian letterforms. Doing the same with Quickscript would be harder since They (the) and She are the same shape on
messageBody:
I remember I made a braille copy based on Shavian letterforms.
Doing the same with Quickscript would be harder since They (the) and
She are the same shape on an all short placement like braille.
P.S. would Pea work as an abbreviation for "per"?

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, amd64_hacker
<amd64_hacker@...> wrote:
>
> I wasn't thinking of leaving them out, I was wondering how best to
> express quikscript in braille. :)
>
> Sorry for the confusion, that was my fault for mixing in an OT
gripe
> about sign language.
>
> tim_rice09 wrote:
> >
> > Why leave Braille users out of spelling reform? With a phonetic
> > touch reading system reading would be made much faster for the
> > visually impared. With all 44 letters (loch, llan and the x's
> > included) there would still be 20 available blocks. Oh yea,
Braille
> > already has a namer dot.
> >
> > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> > <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>, amd64_hacker
> > <amd64_hacker@> wrote:
> > >
> > > Hi,
> > >
> > > That is a very good point.
> > > Rote learning would work up until you encounter a word which
> > wasn't (or
> > > was spelled differently) in your dictionary.
> > >
> > > I've heard that sign languages are pretty independent of
> > written/spoken
> > > languages anyway, so a change of alphabet wouldn't affect them.
> > > It seems to me (and this is only my opinion since I really
have no
> > right
> > > to say one way or the other) that someone who's everyday
language
> > was a
> > > sign language would prefer a system like SignWriting
> > > <http://www.signwriting.org/ <http://www.signwriting.org/>> for
> > their written materials anyway.
> > >
> > > Braille has a near direct mapping with roman letters so a new
> > system
> > > would be needed, any thoughts?
> > >
> > > btw - Sorry for being 'dead' for so long, I've been having ISP
> > issues.
> > >
> > > tim_rice09 wrote:
> > > >
> > > > There is one area where standard spellings with any reform
> > perposal
> > > > are needed, sign language. For the hearing impared any
writing
> > system
> > > > is ideographic since sound-spelling is impossible. Also, for
a
> > new
> > > > sign language new hand signs are needed. A braille like
system is
> > > > needed as well.
> > > >
> > > >
> > >
> >
> >
>
>
>
> ___________________________________________________________
> Try the all-new Yahoo! Mail. "The New Version is radically easier
to use"  The Wall Street Journal
> http://uk.docs.yahoo.com/nowyoucan.html
>
